alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 10:05AM CST until February 12 at 8:24PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Morris, Titus, Red River and Franklin Counties. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding of lowland areas with some secondary roadways closed. All cattle and equipment nearby the river should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 25.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CST Thursday was 25.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.5 feet on 05/01/1908. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1015 AM CST.
